intro: Belamcanda chinensis var. curtata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved yellow flag, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and along stream banks. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense stands. The flowers bloom in late summer, adding vibrant color to wetland habitats.
